data.event: As early as 1983 it was observed by the Foreign Broadcast Information Service that it had the potential to become "one of the most developed and commercial cities in rural Liberia".

event.title: 2004, some 20 acres of land near Ganta were purchased

data.event: In 2004, some 20 acres of land near Ganta were purchased to build a new college, costing $13,500.
American Methodist missionary and physician George Way Harley began working in Ganta in October 1925, where he established a new hospital, dispensary, church, school, and a number of residences.

event.title: established a new Mission in Ganta in 1926

data.event: He found a leper colony there at the time, and established a new Mission in Ganta in 1926.
In September 2014 it was reported that two female victims of the Ebola virus in Ganta, Dorris Quoi and Ma Kebeh, had been "resurrected".
